data.value: # Use in Indication, Posology and method and administration, contraindicated conditions, use in Special Population unapproved in the label

data.name: If you are allergic to cidofovir or any of the other ingredients of this medicine (listed in section 6).
data.value: If you are allergic to cidofovir or any of the other ingredients of this medicine (listed in section 6).

data.name: If you cannot take the medicine probenecid because of a serious allergy to probenecid or other sulfa-containing medicines (e.g. sulfamethoxazole).
data.value: If you cannot take the medicine probenecid because of a serious allergy to probenecid or other sulfa-containing medicines (e.g. sulfamethoxazole).

data.name: If you have diabetes mellitus.Cidofovir should be used with caution in diabetic patients due to the potential increased risk of developing low pressure in the eye (ocular hypotony).
data.value: If you have diabetes mellitus.Cidofovir should be used with caution in diabetic patients due to the potential increased risk of developing low pressure in the eye (ocular hypotony).

data.name: If you have ever had kidney disease.
data.value: If you have ever had kidney disease.

data.name: Induction treatment Dose of cidofovir is 5 mg/kg body weight intravenous infusion at a constant rate over 1 hour) once weekly for two consecutive weeks.
data.value: Induction treatment Dose of cidofovir is 5 mg/kg body weight intravenous infusion at a constant rate over 1 hour) once weekly for two consecutive weeks.

data.name: Kidney damage is the major side effect of cidofovir treatment. Therefore, your doctor may need to monitor carefully, particularly if you already have kidney problems or are on haemodialysis.
data.value: Kidney damage is the major side effect of cidofovir treatment. Therefore, your doctor may need to monitor carefully, particularly if you already have kidney problems or are on haemodialysis.

data.name: Maintenance treatment Beginning two weeks after the completion of induction treatment, the recommended maintenance dose of cidofovir is 5 mg/kg body weight intravenous infusion at a constant rate over 1 hour) administered once every two weeks.
data.value: Maintenance treatment Beginning two weeks after the completion of induction treatment, the recommended maintenance dose of cidofovir is 5 mg/kg body weight intravenous infusion at a constant rate over 1 hour) administered once every two weeks.

data.name: Cidofovir 75 mg/ml concentrate for solution for infusion contains sodium
data.value: Cidofovir 75 mg/ml concentrate for solution for infusion contains sodium

data.value: Cidofovir with food and drink

data.value: Common side effects

data.value: How IV fluids are given before cidofovir

data.value: How to take probenecid with cidofovir

data.value: Possible side effects of taking probenecid

data.value: Pregnancy and breast-feeding

data.name: Very common side effects
data.value: Very common side effects

data.name: Warnings and precautions
data.value: Warnings and precautions

data.name: What is CMV retinitis?
data.value: What is CMV retinitis?

data.name: Cidofovir is used to treat an eye infection called CMV retinitis in patients with AIDS (Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome).  Cidofovir will not cure CMV retinitis but may improve your condition by delaying progression of the disease.
data.value: Cidofovir is used to treat an eye infection called CMV retinitis in patients with AIDS (Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome).  Cidofovir will not cure CMV retinitis but may improve your condition by delaying progression of the disease.

data.name: Common side effects possibly related to probenecid
data.value: Common side effects possibly related to probenecid

data.name: During treatment with cidofovir you should receive regular follow-up eye examinations for possible eye irritation, inflammation or swelling. If you get pain, redness or itching of the eye or changes in your vision, tell your doctor promptly.
data.value: During treatment with cidofovir you should receive regular follow-up eye examinations for possible eye irritation, inflammation or swelling. If you get pain, redness or itching of the eye or changes in your vision, tell your doctor promptly.

data.name: Food should be taken before you are given cidofovir. Your doctor may instruct you to drink plenty of fluids before receiving cidofovir.
data.value: Food should be taken before you are given cidofovir. Your doctor may instruct you to drink plenty of fluids before receiving cidofovir.

data.name: In general, women with HIV should not breast-feed in order to avoid passing HIV to their infant through the milk.
data.value: In general, women with HIV should not breast-feed in order to avoid passing HIV to their infant through the milk.

data.name: It is very important to tell your doctor if you are receiving other medicines that may damage your kidneys.
data.value: It is very important to tell your doctor if you are receiving other medicines that may damage your kidneys.

data.name: Normal saline is given to lower the risk of kidney damage. You should receive a total of one litre of 0.9% (normal) saline solution intravenously (as a drip into a vein) before each cidofovir dose. The saline solution should be infused over a 1 hour period immediately before the cidofovir. If you can tolerate the additional fluid load, your doctor may administer a second litre of fluid. If administered, the second litre of saline should be given either at the start of the cidofovir or immediately afterwards, and infused over a 1 to 3 hour period. Your doctor may also tell you to drink plenty of fluids.
data.value: Normal saline is given to lower the risk of kidney damage. You should receive a total of one litre of 0.9% (normal) saline solution intravenously (as a drip into a vein) before each cidofovir dose. The saline solution should be infused over a 1 hour period immediately before the cidofovir. If you can tolerate the additional fluid load, your doctor may administer a second litre of fluid. If administered, the second litre of saline should be given either at the start of the cidofovir or immediately afterwards, and infused over a 1 to 3 hour period. Your doctor may also tell you to drink plenty of fluids.

data.name: Tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are taking, have recently taken or might take any other medicines, including medicines obtained without a prescription, as these may interact with cidofovir or probenecid.
data.value: Tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are taking, have recently taken or might take any other medicines, including medicines obtained without a prescription, as these may interact with cidofovir or probenecid.

data.name: To lower the risk of kidney damage, probenecid tablets and intravenous fluids (saline solution) must be given on the day of each cidofovir (See sub-sections “How to take probenecid with cidofovir” and “How IV fluids are given before cidofovir” below.)
data.value: To lower the risk of kidney damage, probenecid tablets and intravenous fluids (saline solution) must be given on the day of each cidofovir (See sub-sections “How to take probenecid with cidofovir” and “How IV fluids are given before cidofovir” below.)

data.name: Very common side effects possibly related to probenecid
data.value: Very common side effects possibly related to probenecid

data.name: You should not be given cidofovir if you are breast-feeding. It is not known whether cidofovir is passed on to the baby in human milk. Because many medicines are passed through to human milk, nursing mothers should stop cidofovir or stop breast-feeding if they continue to receive cidofovir.
data.value: You should not be given cidofovir if you are breast-feeding. It is not known whether cidofovir is passed on to the baby in human milk. Because many medicines are passed through to human milk, nursing mothers should stop cidofovir or stop breast-feeding if they continue to receive cidofovir.

data.name: You should not be given cidofovir if you are pregnant. If you become pregnant while receiving this medication, you must inform your doctor immediately. Cidofovir has been shown to cause damage in unborn animals and should not be used during pregnancy unless the potential benefits justify the risks to the foetus. If you could get pregnant, you must use an effective method of contraception to stop you getting pregnant during treatment with cidofovir and for 1 month afterwards.
data.value: You should not be given cidofovir if you are pregnant. If you become pregnant while receiving this medication, you must inform your doctor immediately. Cidofovir has been shown to cause damage in unborn animals and should not be used during pregnancy unless the potential benefits justify the risks to the foetus. If you could get pregnant, you must use an effective method of contraception to stop you getting pregnant during treatment with cidofovir and for 1 month afterwards.

data.name: (These can affect more than 1 user in 10)
data.value: (These can affect more than 1 user in 10)

data.name: Additional reactions reported from post-marketing experience include kidney failure, damage to kidney tubule cells, inflammation of the pancreas and hearing impairment.
data.value: Additional reactions reported from post-marketing experience include kidney failure, damage to kidney tubule cells, inflammation of the pancreas and hearing impairment.

data.name: Any pain, redness or itching of the eye or changes in your vision should be promptly reported to your doctor so that your treatment can be reviewed.
data.value: Any pain, redness or itching of the eye or changes in your vision should be promptly reported to your doctor so that your treatment can be reviewed.

data.name: Beginning two weeks after completion of induction treatment, the recommended maintenance dose of cidofovir in patients with normal kidney function is 5 mg per kg of body weight given once every two weeks.
data.value: Beginning two weeks after completion of induction treatment, the recommended maintenance dose of cidofovir in patients with normal kidney function is 5 mg per kg of body weight given once every two weeks.

data.name: Cidofovir 75 mg/ml concentrate for solution for infusion is given by intravenous infusion (a drip into a vein). It must not be administered by other methods including intraocular injection (direct injection into the eye) or topically (on the skin). Cidofovir must be given by a doctor or nurse with appropriate experience in treating people with AIDS. The doctor or nurse will transfer the appropriate dose of cidofovir from the vial to an infusion bag containing 100 ml 0.9% (normal) saline solution. The entire volume of the bag will be infused into your vein at a constant rate over a period of 1 hour using a standard infusion pump. The recommended dose, frequency of use, or rate of infusion must not be exceeded. At the end of this leaflet, there is further information for healthcare professionals on how to administer cidofovir.
data.value: Cidofovir 75 mg/ml concentrate for solution for infusion is given by intravenous infusion (a drip into a vein). It must not be administered by other methods including intraocular injection (direct injection into the eye) or topically (on the skin). Cidofovir must be given by a doctor or nurse with appropriate experience in treating people with AIDS. The doctor or nurse will transfer the appropriate dose of cidofovir from the vial to an infusion bag containing 100 ml 0.9% (normal) saline solution. The entire volume of the bag will be infused into your vein at a constant rate over a period of 1 hour using a standard infusion pump. The recommended dose, frequency of use, or rate of infusion must not be exceeded. At the end of this leaflet, there is further information for healthcare professionals on how to administer cidofovir.

data.name: Cidofovir caused reduced testes weight and low sperm count (hypospermia) in animals. Although not observed in human studies of cidofovir, such changes may occur in humans and cause infertility. Men should practice barrier birth control methods during and for 3 months after treatment with cidofovir.
data.value: Cidofovir caused reduced testes weight and low sperm count (hypospermia) in animals. Although not observed in human studies of cidofovir, such changes may occur in humans and cause infertility. Men should practice barrier birth control methods during and for 3 months after treatment with cidofovir.

data.name: Cidofovir has not been studied in children. Therefore, this medicine should not be used in children.
data.value: Cidofovir has not been studied in children. Therefore, this medicine should not be used in children.

data.name: Cidofovir is an antiviral medicine which blocks the replication of CMV by interfering with viral DNA production.
data.value: Cidofovir is an antiviral medicine which blocks the replication of CMV by interfering with viral DNA production.

data.name: Cidofovir is not used for the treatment of HIV infection. Cidofovir will not stop you passing HIV infection onto other people so you should continue to take precautions to avoid infecting others.
data.value: Cidofovir is not used for the treatment of HIV infection. Cidofovir will not stop you passing HIV infection onto other people so you should continue to take precautions to avoid infecting others.

data.name: Cidofovir may cause short-term side effects such as fatigue or weakness. If you drive or operate machinery, discuss this with your doctor to get advice about stopping these activities based upon your disease and your tolerance of the medicine.
data.value: Cidofovir may cause short-term side effects such as fatigue or weakness. If you drive or operate machinery, discuss this with your doctor to get advice about stopping these activities based upon your disease and your tolerance of the medicine.

data.name: Cidofovir must be administered by a healthcare professional (doctor or nurse) in a hospital setting.
data.value: Cidofovir must be administered by a healthcare professional (doctor or nurse) in a hospital setting.

data.name: CMV retinitis is an eye infection caused by a virus named cytomegalovirus (CMV). CMV attacks the retina of the eye and may cause loss of vision, and eventually lead to blindness. Patients with AIDS are at high risk of developing CMV retinitis or other forms of CMV disease such as colitis (an inflammatory bowel disease). Treatment for CMV retinitis is necessary to reduce the potential for blindness.
data.value: CMV retinitis is an eye infection caused by a virus named cytomegalovirus (CMV). CMV attacks the retina of the eye and may cause loss of vision, and eventually lead to blindness. Patients with AIDS are at high risk of developing CMV retinitis or other forms of CMV disease such as colitis (an inflammatory bowel disease). Treatment for CMV retinitis is necessary to reduce the potential for blindness.

data.name: For any further information on how your data may be stored or used, please contact us and we will be happy to provide you further information.
data.value: For any further information on how your data may be stored or used, please contact us and we will be happy to provide you further information.

data.name: For further information please do not hesitate to contact us  or speak to your doctor.
data.value: For further information please do not hesitate to contact us  or speak to your doctor.

data.name: If any of these apply to you, talk to your doctor. You are not to be given cidofovir.
data.value: If any of these apply to you, talk to your doctor. You are not to be given cidofovir.

data.name: If you have accidentally been given more cidofovir than prescribed for you, tell your doctor immediately.
data.value: If you have accidentally been given more cidofovir than prescribed for you, tell your doctor immediately.

data.name: If you have any further questions on the use of this medicine, ask your doctor or pharmacist or nurse.
data.value: If you have any further questions on the use of this medicine, ask your doctor or pharmacist or nurse.

data.name: If you have kidney problems, cidofovir may not be appropriate treatment for you. Samples of your urine and/or blood will be taken before each infusion of cidofovir and used for testing kidney function. For patients with evidence of decreased kidney function, your cidofovir dose may be interrupted or stopped depending on your individual case.
data.value: If you have kidney problems, cidofovir may not be appropriate treatment for you. Samples of your urine and/or blood will be taken before each infusion of cidofovir and used for testing kidney function. For patients with evidence of decreased kidney function, your cidofovir dose may be interrupted or stopped depending on your individual case.

data.name: Inflammation of the eye, reduced pressure in the eyes, difficult or laboured breathing, shortness of breath, diarrhoea and chills.
data.value: Inflammation of the eye, reduced pressure in the eyes, difficult or laboured breathing, shortness of breath, diarrhoea and chills.

data.name: Like all medicines, this medicine can cause side effects, although not everybody gets them.
data.value: Like all medicines, this medicine can cause side effects, although not everybody gets them.

data.name: low white blood cell counts, headache, nausea, vomiting, protein in the urine, increase in blood creatinine (a measure of kidney function), hair loss, rash, weakness/fatigue and fever.
data.value: low white blood cell counts, headache, nausea, vomiting, protein in the urine, increase in blood creatinine (a measure of kidney function), hair loss, rash, weakness/fatigue and fever.

data.name: PASSs can either be clinical trials or non-interventional studies.
data.value: PASSs can either be clinical trials or non-interventional studies.

data.name: Probenecid is only taken on the same day that cidofovir is given.
data.value: Probenecid is only taken on the same day that cidofovir is given.

data.name: Probenecid may also cause other side effects including loss of appetite, sore gums, flushing, hair loss, dizziness, reduced red blood cell count and increased frequency of passing water (urinating). Allergic reactions, with skin inflammation, itching, hives and, rarely, severe allergic reactions, and serious skin reaction have occurred. There have been reports of reduced white blood counts, liver toxicity, kidney toxicity and destruction of red blood cells. Reductions in blood cell and platelet counts have also occurred.
data.value: Probenecid may also cause other side effects including loss of appetite, sore gums, flushing, hair loss, dizziness, reduced red blood cell count and increased frequency of passing water (urinating). Allergic reactions, with skin inflammation, itching, hives and, rarely, severe allergic reactions, and serious skin reaction have occurred. There have been reports of reduced white blood counts, liver toxicity, kidney toxicity and destruction of red blood cells. Reductions in blood cell and platelet counts have also occurred.

data.name: Probenecid may interact with other medicines commonly used in the treatment of AIDS and AIDS-related illnesses, such as zidovudine (AZT). If you are taking zidovudine, you should discuss with your doctor whether to temporarily stop taking zidovudine or decrease the dose of zidovudine by 50% on days when cidofovir and probenecid are given.
data.value: Probenecid may interact with other medicines commonly used in the treatment of AIDS and AIDS-related illnesses, such as zidovudine (AZT). If you are taking zidovudine, you should discuss with your doctor whether to temporarily stop taking zidovudine or decrease the dose of zidovudine by 50% on days when cidofovir and probenecid are given.

data.name: Probenecid tablets are given to lower the risk of kidney damage. You must take 3 doses of probenecid tablets orally on the same day as cidofovir as shown in the following table:
data.value: Probenecid tablets are given to lower the risk of kidney damage. You must take 3 doses of probenecid tablets orally on the same day as cidofovir as shown in the following table:

data.name: Should you be interested in participating in the Cidofovir Exposure Registry, please visit the website www.cidofovir.com.
data.value: Should you be interested in participating in the Cidofovir Exposure Registry, please visit the website www.cidofovir.com.

data.name: Talk to your doctor or pharmacist or nurse before using cidofovir.
data.value: Talk to your doctor or pharmacist or nurse before using cidofovir.

data.name: The dose you will need is calculated based on your body weight.
data.value: The dose you will need is calculated based on your body weight.

data.name: The European medicinces agency has requested Tillomed to implement a non-interventional PASS Study for the additional monitoring of Cidofovir through an exposure registry the United Kingdom, Germany, Belgium and Spain
data.value: The European medicinces agency has requested Tillomed to implement a non-interventional PASS Study for the additional monitoring of Cidofovir through an exposure registry the United Kingdom, Germany, Belgium and Spain

data.name: The most common side effect observed with cidofovir is damage to the kidneys.
data.value: The most common side effect observed with cidofovir is damage to the kidneys.

data.name: The potential for interactions between cidofovir and anti-HIV protease inhibitors has not been studied.
data.value: The potential for interactions between cidofovir and anti-HIV protease inhibitors has not been studied.

data.name: The purpose of the information in PASS’s is to evaluate the safety and benefit-risk profile of a medicine and support regulatory decision-making. They aim to:
data.value: The purpose of the information in PASS’s is to evaluate the safety and benefit-risk profile of a medicine and support regulatory decision-making. They aim to:

data.name: The recommended dose of cidofovir in patients with normal kidney function is 5 mg per kg of body weight given once weekly for two consecutive weeks.
data.value: The recommended dose of cidofovir in patients with normal kidney function is 5 mg per kg of body weight given once weekly for two consecutive weeks.

data.name: The safety and efficacy of cidofovir has not been demonstrated in diseases other than CMV retinitis in patients with AIDS.
data.value: The safety and efficacy of cidofovir has not been demonstrated in diseases other than CMV retinitis in patients with AIDS.

data.name: Therefore, before giving you probenecid your doctor should consult the current prescribing information regarding the safety of probenecid. You should also read the probenecid package leaflet.
data.value: Therefore, before giving you probenecid your doctor should consult the current prescribing information regarding the safety of probenecid. You should also read the probenecid package leaflet.

data.name: These medicines must be stopped at least 7 days before taking cidofovir.
data.value: These medicines must be stopped at least 7 days before taking cidofovir.

data.name: These side effects usually disappear when treatment with cidofovir is stopped. If any of the side effects gets serious, or if you notice any side effects not listed in this leaflet, please tell your doctor or pharmacist immediately.
data.value: These side effects usually disappear when treatment with cidofovir is stopped. If any of the side effects gets serious, or if you notice any side effects not listed in this leaflet, please tell your doctor or pharmacist immediately.

data.name: This medicine contains 2.5 mmol (or 57 mg) sodium per vial which should be taken into consideration if you are on a controlled sodium diet.
data.value: This medicine contains 2.5 mmol (or 57 mg) sodium per vial which should be taken into consideration if you are on a controlled sodium diet.

data.name: This study will allow identification of new safety information pertaining to cidofovir usage.
data.value: This study will allow identification of new safety information pertaining to cidofovir usage.

data.name: Tillomed are conducting a non-interventional Post Authorisation Safety Study for the safety of Cidofovir through a patient registry in the United Kingdom, Germany, Belgium and Spain.
data.value: Tillomed are conducting a non-interventional Post Authorisation Safety Study for the safety of Cidofovir through a patient registry in the United Kingdom, Germany, Belgium and Spain.

data.name: To reduce the risk of nausea and/or vomiting associated with taking probenecid, you should eat food before each dose. Your doctor might instruct you to take other medicines such as anti-emetics (anti sickness medicines), antihistamines and/or paracetamol to decrease the side effects of probenecid.
data.value: To reduce the risk of nausea and/or vomiting associated with taking probenecid, you should eat food before each dose. Your doctor might instruct you to take other medicines such as anti-emetics (anti sickness medicines), antihistamines and/or paracetamol to decrease the side effects of probenecid.

data.name: This is an observational/non-interventional, multi-centre, multi-national, Cidofovir Exposure Registry based, cohort study with prospective patient enrolment and follow-up. This registry will spread across UK, France, Germany and Spain. The aim of this registry is to collect safety data in patients being prescribed Emcure’s Cidofovir formulation (Cidofovir Emcure Pharma 75 mg/ml Concentrate for Solution for Infusion). The information collected in this registry will be used to understand the pattern of side effects of Cidofovir use and the medical condition for which Cidofovir is being prescribed by you. This is a long term exposure study which would enable to identify new safety information of Cidofovir.
data.value: This is an observational/non-interventional, multi-centre, multi-national, Cidofovir Exposure Registry based, cohort study with prospective patient enrolment and follow-up. This registry will spread across UK, France, Germany and Spain. The aim of this registry is to collect safety data in patients being prescribed Emcure’s Cidofovir formulation (Cidofovir Emcure Pharma 75 mg/ml Concentrate for Solution for Infusion). The information collected in this registry will be used to understand the pattern of side effects of Cidofovir use and the medical condition for which Cidofovir is being prescribed by you. This is a long term exposure study which would enable to identify new safety information of Cidofovir.

data.name: Tillomed is a European Pharmaceutical company with headquarters in the UK and subsidiaries in France, Spain, Germany, Italy and MENA.

data.name: To evaluate patterns and incidence of the occurrence of adverse events in patients who are being treated for the indication authorized for Cidofovir as against any other indication for which it may be prescribed.
data.value: To evaluate patterns and incidence of the occurrence of adverse events in patients who are being treated for the indication authorized for Cidofovir as against any other indication for which it may be prescribed.

data.name: To identify the indications and patient populations for Cidofovir use.
data.value: To identify the indications and patient populations for Cidofovir use.

data.name: Treatment of CMV retinitis in adults with acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS) and without renal dysfunction. It should be used only when other medicinal products are considered unsuitable.
data.value: Treatment of CMV retinitis in adults with acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS) and without renal dysfunction. It should be used only when other medicinal products are considered unsuitable.
